name: greedy_neighbor
description: Social dilemma with high work cost creating free-riding incentive
story: Fires spread slowly, but helping neighbors costs valuable rest time. Selfish agents can rely on others to work. The high work cost (c=1.0) creates a classic social dilemma between cooperation and free-riding.
research_questions: What cooperation rate emerges in Nash equilibrium?
Can evolution find the Nash mixed strategy?
At what work cost does cooperation collapse?
How do free riders perform in mixed populations?
